page.title: 03CITY-CENTRE DEVELOPMENTS 1
page.content: Union Street is the central focus for shopping in Aberdeen.The shops were once predominately small privately owned family businesses.But over the years this has gradually changed and similar to many other towns there are now a large number of well known chain stores.The latest developments of the St Nicholas Centre and the Trinity Centre have most definately concentrated shopping to the East end of Union Street probably to the detriment of those at the west end. There are further concerns about the proposed "BREDERO" development also to be located at this east end.This Â£65 million shopping centre was given the go ahead this month by the Scottish office despite strong local opposition from many quarters.
